ngiemboon: «Gù míŋ nyìŋ mesoŋ, pí nně ncù gie é ne ńdúmo mboŋó, ńdɔg ńgÿo lísà. Ńdɔg ńkwóon menoŋo twó mú lâ melÿò mú, e mie ɔ̀ kwǒon, ɔ̀ gabte menzsè tà e gyɔ́ɔn, éfʉʼʉ na fʉ̀ʼncʉ̂e.
en: “Now you, son of man, take a sharp sword,   use it as you would a barber’s razor, and shave your head and beard. Then take a set of scales and divide the hair.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ gʉa mǒ, ḿbíi tàʼ nzsè na menzsè méntá, ńzyɛ́ʼ tà ńkúu tsetsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ ńtuɔ, á fʉ̀ʼ gie megàŋmbù kelé tÿǒsoŋ tà ḿbumo lélÿɔ́ʼɔ yɛ̌ né ncù. Ɔ̀ ge gÿo píi mbɔ́ɔntè nzsè yépʉ́a á na menzsè méntá, é lɔg nně ncù jù tsyete, é lɔg kéle tÿǒsoŋ. Nzsòte nzèm na menzsè méntá, ɔ̀ maʼ fèfà kaa, n dɔg yɔ̀ɔn nně ncù ńnɔ́ɔnte.
en: You are to burn a third of it in the city when the days of the siege have ended;   you are to take a third and slash it with the sword all around the city; and you are to scatter a third to the wind, for I will draw a sword to chase after them.

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ɔ̀ ge gÿo leʼe tsɔ̌ méjʉʼ na menoŋ ŋwɛ́, á tsɛ̀ɛ múɔ pɔ̀ɔn nzsǒ jù, á jʉʼ gie ngwɔ́ tsɔ́ mmó le kíbe.
en: But you are to take a few strands from the hair and secure them in the folds of your robe.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ ge gíŋ gʉa mǒ, é pí tsɔ́ ntáʼ menoŋ mie ɔ̀ ge tuɔ, etsɔ́ mmɔ̌g kẅɛɛ mǒ, ńtuɔ pa Ésàlayɛ metsèm.
en: Take some more of them, throw them into the fire, and burn them in it.   A fire will spread from it to the whole house of Israel.

ngiemboon: Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé, e shʉ̌ashʉa ńgɔɔn ngie, yɛ̂ áa mmó gie á ge gÿo tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ Yelúzálèm. Á tÿǒsoŋ gie n da tÿɔ́gɔ tsetsɛ̀ɛ metsɔ́ mengwòŋ, á gie n da gÿo mengwòŋ ndyɛ̀ʼɛ kéle ńnéŋe soŋ.
en: “This is what the Lord God says: I have set this Jerusalem in the center of the nations, with countries all around her.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a láʼ apɛ̌ la gwáʼ membʉ̌ mie n da náa mbwó pɔ́b, ńdʉʼʉ le tÿɔ́gɔ kwò na mentÿɔgɔ́ mɔ́ɔn. Ńdɔgɔ púʼu, éfʉʼʉ menò tepòŋ, tà ńtɔ́gɔ metsɔ́ meláʼa ndyɛ̀ʼɛ, mbɔɔ meláʼ mie ée mengʉ̀ŋe láʼ pɔ́b.
en: She has rebelled against my ordinances with more wickedness than the nations, and against my statutes more than the countries that surround her. For her people have rejected my ordinances and have not walked in my statutes.

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ tá mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé, e shʉ̌ashʉa ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: Pi ka gíŋ ḿbú ńcʉŋ jʉʼ, tà ńtɔ́g metsɔ́ meláʼ mie ée ngʉ̀ŋe láʼ pi. Pi ka te giŋ páʼ mentÿɔgɔ́ mɔ́ɔn ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́, pi ka te tÿɔ́gɔ kwò na membʉ̌ mie n da záb wɔ́. Pi ka zɔɔn fó te giŋ páʼ mà we meláʼ mie ée mengʉ̀ŋe láʼ pi, à ne ńzɛ́te wɔ́.
en: “Therefore, this is what the Lord God says: Because you have been more insubordinate than the nations around you    #— #you have not walked in my statutes or kept my ordinances; you have not even kept the ordinances of the nations around you #— #

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿǒ mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé, e shʉ̌ashʉa ńgɔɔn yɔ́ɔn ngie: N ge gÿo yɔɔn nò na pi, pi pʉ̀a Yelúzálèm. N ge tyé pɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ, á mángyɛ̌, é tsɔ́ʼte ntsaŋ gi, é gÿo mmó gie ńzába légÿo na pi, á menÿɔ́g ngwòŋo ngwòŋ.
en: therefore, this is what the Lord God says: See, I myself am against you, Jerusalem, and I will execute judgments within you in the sight of the nations.

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo nò na pi, á gie n zɔɔn laa tsɔ́ púʼu gÿo, é ké le láʼa lyɛ̌ʼ ńgíŋe ńgÿo tsɔ́ púʼu wɔ́. Ńtí mentʉ̀ menò tepòŋ mí.
en: Because of all your detestable practices, I will do to you what I have never done before and what I will never do again.

ngiemboon: Á ge gÿo gwɔ́ tÿǒsoŋ, metá penkʉ́ ne ḿpfɛ́ɛ penkʉ́ pɔ́b, penkʉ́ ne ḿpfɛ́ɛ metá pɔ́b. N ge gÿo gÿo mmó gie n tsɔʼté ntsaŋ gi ńzába légÿo, é tága pfwɔ̀ʼɔ pʉ̀a pí, é lɔg sa njÿó mesǎg lekùɔ.
en: As a result, fathers will eat their sons   within Jerusalem,  # 5:10 Lit you and sons will eat their fathers. I will execute judgments against you and scatter all your survivors to every direction of the wind.

ngiemboon: Páʼ n ge láʼa gwɔ́ pɔ́ wó la, mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Ssé ne ńgɔɔn ngie: pi ka lɔg mentʉ̀ menò tepòŋ mí, mbɔɔ menkʉʼʉ menò tepòŋ mí, ńnéŋe lɔ̌ʼ na jʉʼʉ Ndʉalʉ̌a yɔ́ɔn, áa yɛ̌ tá mèŋ yɔ́ɔn n ge fó lejʉ́ŋ pi ésẅɛʼte nnɛ́, é cʉ́ʼ gwɔ́ pɔ́ te tsɔ̌ɔn mezìŋe, alagá nyìŋ te gÿo tsɔgɔ mbwó mèŋ wɔ́.
en: “Therefore, as I live” #— #this is the declaration of the Lord God  #— #“I will withdraw and show you no pity, because you have defiled my sanctuary   with all your abhorrent acts and detestable practices.  # 5:11 Ezk 7:20; 11:18,21 Yes, I will not spare you.

ngiemboon: Gwáʼa kà gwáŋa wɔ́ɔ, ge gÿo zẅé tàʼ nzsè na nzsè tá á na pʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ tÿǒsoŋ. Mé ge gÿo lɔg nně ncù, é zẅéte pʉ̀a mbɔ́ɔntè nzsè yépʉ́a na nzsè tá á megʉ̀ŋe tÿǒsoŋ, é gÿo epʉ̀a mbɔ́ɔntè yétá na nzsè tá, é tága ésa jʉʼ na meshÿó lekùɔ, n gwɔ́ nzèm pɔ́b lé nně ncù yɔ̀ɔn.
en: A third of your people will die by plague and be consumed by famine within you;   a third will fall by the sword all around you; and I will scatter a third to every direction of the wind, and I will draw a sword to chase after them.  # 5:12 Jr 15:2; 43:10–11; 44:27

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo gÿo na pi páʼ gyáŋalóŋ yɔ́ɔn ne ńtsóte wɔ́ɔn púʼu, é záb ngɔ́ʼ twó pi tà cʉ́me, é lɔg tsɔ́ʼɔ piŋé nò gie pi ka gÿo na mèŋ. Pi leen ńké ńzsé ngie mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ gɔɔn nò mbwó pi. Mélàʼmie peg lâ pate pyennɛ́ te teme nò wɔ́, áa mmó gie á gÿo n ge nyé máa gyáŋalóŋ wɔ̀ɔn faʼa yé fàʼ na pi tà ńcʉ́me.
en: When my anger is spent and I have vented my wrath on them, I will be appeased.   Then after I have spent my wrath on them, they will know that I, the Lord, have spoken in my jealousy.  # 5:13 Ezk 36:5–6; 38:19

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a meláʼ mie ée mengʉ̀ŋe láʼ pi, lâ pʉ̀a pie é ge gÿo cʉa láʼ pi, pɔ́ ge gÿo gyá páʼ n kéen ḿbyága tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm, ńcʉŋ nzẅìŋ wé.
en: “I will make you a ruin and a disgrace among the nations around you, in the sight of everyone who passes by.

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo lɔgɔ máa gyáŋalóŋ, é gÿo yɔ́ɔn mmó gie n ka tsɔ́ʼte ntsaŋ yɔb, ńzába légÿo, é lɔg menò tà ńgyɔ́ɔn mie n ne ńdaʼa wɔ́b mǒ, éfómo wɔ́b. Epʉ̀a pie ée mengʉ̀ŋe láʼ pɔ́b zoonte wɔ́b, ńgẅe tÿǒsoŋ yɔ́b. Tá é ké ńgwɔ́ fʉ̌ʼnò mbwó pɔ́b, é gẅie é kagá tuŋó yɔ́b tà pɔ́ vɛ, mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ gɔɔn nò.
en: So you   will be a disgrace and a taunt, a warning and a horror, to the nations around you when I execute judgments against you in anger,  # 5:15 Ps 79:3–10; Ezk 22:4 wrath, and furious rebukes. I, the Lord, have spoken.

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo maʼa ntʉ̀ gwáŋa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, páʼ mekwoŋ kyɛ́d ncù la, lélɔg ńzẅéte gẅí. É cʉŋte shúm léjÿó sie pi ka leʼe tsɛ̀ɛ menkìŋ, é lɔg gÿo, agẅi gwáŋa pú ńgáʼ.
en: When I shoot deadly arrows of famine at them, arrows for destruction that I will send to destroy you, inhabitants of Jerusalem, I will intensify the famine against you and cut off your supply of bread.

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo maʼa gwáŋa lâ menɔ̀ɔn pie é zẅéte pʉ̀a, á tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, pɔ́ tó ńzẅéte gubé gí. N ge gÿo lɔgɔ gwáʼa lâ tág, mbɔɔ ncù, é pyága gẅí. Mèŋ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a zɔ gɔɔn.»
en: I will send famine and dangerous animals against you. They will leave you childless. Plague and bloodshed will sweep through you, and I will bring a sword against you. I, the Lord, have spoken.”
